user.biography: Greenpeace exists because this fragile earth deserves a voice. It needs solutions. It needs change. It needs action.

node.text:
#MobilityWeek 2021 launches today 🎉

The transport sector is one of the biggest contributors to rising emissions and global warming. We have no more time to waste!

This European Mobility Week, we are mobilizing to demand a change in the design of our cities and towns, to reclaim space that has been gradually conquered by the car that we must take back now with a focus on climate mitigation, community, inclusion, and accessibility.

But no one should be left behind in the necessary transformation towards a climate-friendly mobility system. The mobility of the future is also socially just.

Let’s demand #MobilityForAll.

#mobilityforallnow #mobility #transport #citylife #cities #inclusion #socialjutice #climatejustice #publictransport #fightinequality #care #cars #lesscars #savepeoplenotplanes #cycling #movesustainably #stayhealthy #cleanair #airpollution #noisepollution #transformtransport #greencities

node.title: Mobility Week - Mobility should be climate-friendly and socially just!

node.text:
Fishermen on the outskirts of Matadi, in the Democratic Republic of Congo, say plastic is threatening their livelihoods. Not only does plastic pollution end up in their nets, but in the fish they catch. The most vulnerable communities are often impacted the worst by plastic pollution.
#PlasticFreeSeptember #BreakFreeFromPlastic

node.text:
50 years ago this month a crew of activists set out to sail into the path of a nuclear bomb blast and created Greenpeace. 
.
Over five decades – on all continents and oceans – together we have spoken truth to power, borne witness, stopped, blocked and placed our bodies in the way of environmental destruction. We have investigated and documented ecological contamination and crime. We have conducted scientific studies, litigated and lobbied. We have tried, failed and tried again. We have also succeeded!
.
As we commemorate, and celebrate, 50 years since the Greenpeace set sail, we are painfully aware of the gathering storm wrought by inequity, greed and corruption, of accelerating habitat destruction and the deepening climate emergency. We look to the past for learnings on how to face the future. We celebrate the passion and commitment of all who make Greenpeace possible 💚
.
.
#HopeInAction #GP50th #Greenpeace50

node.text:
Air pollution is a silent killer, responsible for an estimated 7 million deaths globally each year, and a leading cause of lung cancer, heart disease, stroke and asthma. 

But it is also a problem that we know how to solve, and we are demanding that governments take action. Join us in sharing your air pollution story using the hashtag #CleanAirNow. 
.
.
#WorldCleanAirDay #HealthyAirHealthyPlanet #airpollution #greenpeace

node.title: Tell us your air pollution story

node.text:
It’s one of the world’s most treasured natural jewels, but the Great Barrier Reef is losing its beautiful colours. 
.
This is what the coal industry is doing to one of Australia's most remarkable natural wonders.
.
.
#greenpeace #reef #GBR #Australia #climatechange #globalwarming

node.title: Great Barrier Reef is losing its beautiful colours.

node.text:
Earlier this week, thousands of Indigenous Peoples marched to the Brazilian Congress to symbolically demarcate Brasília with 1,296 signs representing all the Indigenous Lands claimed by Indigenous Peoples in Brazil, in a protest against the government's refusal on demarcating Indigenous Lands.
Around 6,000 Indigenous Peoples have gathered this week at the Struggle for Life camp to fight for their lands and lives. 
.
.
.
.
#StruggleForLife #IndigenousEmergency #MarcoTemporalNão

node.title: Protest for the Demarcation of Indigenous Lands in Brazil

node.text:
More than 5,000 Indigenous leaders from all over the country are meeting at the #StruggleforLife camp in Brasilia this week to defend their rights against the anti-Indigenous agenda that advances in Brazil’s Congress and await a critical Supreme Court decision that will define the future for their lives, their lands and for the environmental conservation in Brazil. Forests thrive when Indigenous Rights are respected✊
.
.
.
.
#IndigenousEmergency #LutaPelaVida #MarcoTemporalNão

node.title: Struggle for Life Camp 2021 in Brasília, Brazil

node.text:
If the world is on fire, you don’t throw more fuel on it.

That’s what we’re doing by allowing the expansion of fossil fuel production.

How about a non-proliferation treaty... on fossil fuels?

via @fossilfueltreaty

#fossilfueltreaty #nonproliferation #fossilfuels #bigoil #oilcompanies #climateemergency #climatecrisis #biodiversitycrisis #humanrights #climatejustice #solutions #coalphaseout #fossilfuelphaseout #energy #climate #climateaction

node.title: Towards a fossil fuel non-proliferation treaty?

node.text:
The Sámi people, the only existing Indigenous People in the EU, live in the northern part of what today is Scandinavia, Finland and Russia.

The Sámi community in Muonio is now fighting for their way of life. The Swedish state-owned forestry giant Sveaskog, is clearcutting huge areas in their lands, devastating traditional livelihoods, destroying biodiversity, and further eroding nature’s ability to combat climate change.

The community issued an ultimatum, demanding that Sveaskog stops ALL activities in the area, at least until proper consultation with the community. 

Will you help them to make Sveaskog listen? Tag @sveaskog  in the comments.

#sveaskog #sweden #scandinavia #forests #forestprotection #Sami #SamiPeople #IndigenousPeoples #landrights #humanrights #deforestation #forestdestruction #reindeerherding #biodiversitycrisis #climatecrisis

node.title: Stand with the Sámi for the forests!

node.text:
#floods and intense tropical storms have wreaked havoc in cities across the world.
.
But this could get worse. Ten years from now, cities like Jakarta and Taipei could be seriously affected by typhoons and rising sea levels, putting the lives of millions of people at risk.
How much it will rise depends mostly on the rate of future carbon dioxide emissions and global warming. Hope lies in action. Governments and leaders must take an immediate climate action to prevent this worst impact of climate change.
Share this video.
.
.
.
#ClimateEmergency #2030SeaLevelRise #ExtremeSeaLevelRise #climatechange #jakarta

node.title: The sea is rising higher and faster

From August 2020 to July 2021, 8.712 sq km of the Amazon was destroyed in Brazil. Bolsonaro’s government is a threat to biodiversity, Indigenous Peoples rights, and to the global climate.
.
.
.
.
#ActForTheAmazon #ZeroDeforestation

In the summer of 2015, protestors gathered at Shell's drilling ship, the Polar Pioneer, that had arrived in Elliot Bay near Seattle, Chicago, USA. Shell was preparing its equipment for oil exploration in the Alaskan Arctic. 
.
© @nstrimble).
.
50 years ago, a crew of activists set out to sail into the path of a nuclear bomb blast, and Greenpeace was born. This year, we would like to commemorate 50 years of hard lessons, sweet victories, and the incredible people who have always been the heart of Greenpeace. 

#Greenpeace50 #Greenpeace

node.text:
An oil slick from the infamous Deepwater Horizon oil disaster, which occurred when an oil platform leased by British Petroleum exploded, burned, and sank into the ocean in 2010. 11 workers died during the disaster, and oil flowed from the well and into the Gulf of Mexico for 87 days. An estimated 800 million litres of oil and gas leaked from the broken pipeline and into the ocean. 
.
© @danielbeltraphoto
.
.

node.text:
#MobilityWeek 2021 launches today 🎉

The transport sector is one of the biggest contributors to rising emissions and global warming. We have no more time to waste!

This European Mobility Week, we are mobilizing to demand a change in the design of our cities and towns, to reclaim space that has been gradually conquered by the car that we must take back now with a focus on climate mitigation, community, inclusion, and accessibility.

But no one should be left behind in the necessary transformation towards a climate-friendly mobility system. The mobility of the future is also socially just.

Let’s demand #MobilityForAll.

#mobilityforallnow #mobility #transport #citylife #cities #inclusion #socialjutice #climatejustice #publictransport #fightinequality #care #cars #lesscars #savepeoplenotplanes #cycling #movesustainably #stayhealthy #cleanair #airpollution #noisepollution #transformtransport #greencities

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Greenpeace International 🌍 on September 16, 2021. May be an image of ocean.

node.text:
One of @Greenpeace’s most widely-known actions, the occupation of the Brent Spar Oil Rig, took place in the North Sea in June 1995. 

Activists occupied the rig for more than three weeks as part of a coordinated worldwide campaign putting pressure on Shell’s proposed “deep sea disposal” of the rig that included 11,000 tonnes of oil into the ocean. The campaign was eventually successful with Shell abandoning its plans to dispose of the oil rig in the ocean. 

 © Harald Zindler, © David Sims, © Ulrich Jurgens, © Peter Thompson
.
.
50 years ago, a crew of activists set out to sail into the path of a nuclear bomb blast, and Greenpeace was born. This year, we would like to commemorate 50 years of hard lessons, sweet victories, and the incredible people who have always been the heart of Greenpeace. 

#Greenpeace50 #Greenpeace

node.text:
Another core value of @Greenpeace is the principle of “bearing witness” - ensuring the general public know the real costs of the destruction of the natural world. 
.
In 2013, rescue workers, local volunteers and PTT personnel attempted to clean up the oil spill at Ao Phrao beach in Ko Samet, Rayong Province, Thailand, one of the areas most affected by the oil spill. 
.
More than 50,000 liters of crude oil was spilled into the sea following a leak from a pipeline at an offshore platform. Greenpeace was there to document the true scale of the damage and to call on the Thai government to review its energy policy and to put an end to oil drilling and exploration in the Gulf of Thailand.
.
 © Roengrit Kongmuang
.
.
50 years ago, a crew of activists set out to sail into the path of a nuclear bomb blast, and Greenpeace was born. This year, we would like to commemorate 50 years of hard lessons, sweet victories, and the incredible people who have always been the heart of Greenpeace. 
.
#Greenpeace50 #Greenpeace

node.text:
In 2016, a @Greenpeace team documented the rapidly changing Arctic environment. The Save the Arctic campaign is a major chapter of Greenpeace history. As global temperatures warm and sea ice melts, open water in the Arctic makes oil extraction even easier. For corporations that have profited off of fossil fuels, that’s great news, but for the rest of us, it’s devastating. 
.
1st Image: A polar bear resting in the icy water in Svalbard, to the north of Norway. 
.
2nd Image: The Greenpeace Arctic Sunrise photographed from the air in the Fram Strait, not far from the north west coast of Svalbard, as it passes through small broken floes of sea ice in September 2011.
.
As global temperatures warm and sea ice melts, open water in the Arctic makes oil extraction even easier. For corporations that have profited off of fossil fuels, that’s great news, but for the rest of us it’s devastating.
.
 © Rasmus Törnqvist, Nick Cobbing 
.
50 years ago, a crew of activists set out to sail into the path of a nuclear bomb blast, and Greenpeace was born. This year, we would like to commemorate 50 years of hard lessons, sweet victories, and the incredible people who have always been the heart of Greenpeace.

node.text:
The Antarctic ocean supports an abundance of incredible life: penguins, whales, fish, seals, and colossal squid. But a warming climate and expanding industrial fishing are threatening this vital ocean and its iconic creatures. 
.
Greenpeace has been conducting scientific research and documenting the Antarctic’s unique wildlife to strengthen the proposal to create the largest protected area on the planet - an Antarctic Ocean Sanctuary. Ocean sanctuaries are areas of ocean off limits to harmful industrial activity such as fishing, mining and oil drilling. These protected areas allow wildlife to recover, and for a natural balance to be restored.
.
©Paul Hilton, Daniel Beltrá, Christian Åslund
.
.
50 years ago, a crew of activists set out to sail into the path of a nuclear bomb blast, and Greenpeace was born. This year, we would like to commemorate 50 years of hard lessons, sweet victories, and the incredible people who have always been the heart of Greenpeace. 
.

node.text:
Greenpeace’s mission is to ensure the ability of the earth to nurture life in all its diversity, which means protecting biodiversity in all its forms. An essential part of our campaigns is the documentation of the natural world. 
.
.
Penguins have lived in the Antarctic for millions of years. They’re perfectly adapted for surviving conditions in one of the harshest environments on earth. Greenpeace is campaigning to protect the Antarctic Ocean, backed by nearly 2 million people globally, and received unprecedented support from the majority of krill fishing companies operating in Antarctic waters. Nearly all krill companies operating in the Antarctic will voluntarily stop fishing in huge areas around the Antarctic Peninsula, including “buffer zones” around breeding colonies of penguins to protect Antarctic wildlife.
.
Greenpeace has been conducting scientific research and documenting the Antarctic’s unique wildlife to strengthen the proposal to create the largest protected area on the planet - an Antarctic Ocean Sanctuary. Ocean sanctuaries are areas of ocean off limits to harmful industrial activity such as fishing, mining and oil drilling. These protected areas allow wildlife to recover, and for a natural balance to be restored.
.
©Abbie Trayler-Smith
.
.
50 years ago, a crew of activists set out to sail into the path of a nuclear bomb blast, and Greenpeace was born. This year, we would like to commemorate 50 years of hard lessons, sweet victories, and the incredible people who have always been the heart of Greenpeace. 
.
#Greenpeace50 #Greenpeace

node.text:
Villagers in central India celebrate the Indian Government’s decision to stop mining in the forest in 2015. 
.
Coal burning causes a trail of destruction that is no less harmful than coal mining. Coal powered plants emit harmful pollutants such as carbon dioxide, sulphur dioxide, nitrogen oxide, and methane, which are major air pollutants and one of the main contributors to climate change. Coal is in decline globally, but India is struggling to cut its ties to the energy source.
.
©Sudhanshu malhotra @confusedtravelerr
.
.

node.text:
🚨 [BREAKING] Today, @greenpeaceusa released a report ⁠exposing that major Big Oil companies supply fossil fuels that become the petrochemicals used to make big brands, like @cocacola, @pepsi & @nestle’s single-use plastics.

The Greenpeace USA investigative team went to extreme lengths to trace the opaque supply chain linking fossil fuel products to each brand's plastic bottles and packaging.

This report calls out major household brands are throwing the fossil fuel industry a lifeline by relying on them to increase single-use plastic production, and in turn helping to fuel the climate crisis.

If industry has its way, plastic production could double by 2030.

We can't let this happen.

☝️ Check out the link in our bio to learn more and take action 📢

#BreakFreeFromPlastic
